meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>copy</kanji>, but what is a copy? It is basically a photograph, which is why this word means <vocabulary>to be photographed</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>to be in a photograph</vocabulary>. You know this one is "to be photographed" because it ends with a る. Someone thinks you're "<reading>ru</reading>de" so they're photographing you.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

You have to remember the うつ part. You're being rude, right? That's why you got photographed. Why are you rude? You're doing beatboxing, constantly saying <reading>うつ</reading>うつうつ over and over again. Say it out loud, too.
